query: How are topological qubits being developed and tested by leading research institutions in 2024?

results.title: Research Team Achieves First-Ever Topological Qubit, A Step Along ...
results.content: Researchers have created what they are referring to as the first-ever experimentally demonstrated true topological qubit.

results.title: Microsoft quantum computing 'breakthrough' faces fresh challenge
results.content: # Microsoft quantum computing ‘breakthrough’ faces fresh challenge. A physicist has cast doubt on a test that underlies a high-profile claim by Microsoft to have created the first ‘topological qubits’, a long-sought goal of the company’s quantum-computing effort. results.title: Microsoft Announces Development of Its First Operational ...
results.content: Microsoft has developed a controllable topological qubit module design that they intend on scaling up very quickly to produce a 1 million qubit error corrected

results.title: 'We have created a new state of matter': New topological quantum ...
results.content: # ‘We have created a new state of matter’: New topological quantum processor marks breakthrough in computing. Majorana 1, the eight-qubit topological quantum processor unveiled at Microsoft Station Q's 2025 conference. **In a leap forward for quantum computing, a Microsoft team led by UC Santa Barbara physicists on Wednesday unveiled an eight-qubit topological quantum processor, the first of its kind. “We’ve got a bunch of stuff that we’ve been keeping under wraps that we’re dropping all at once now,” said Microsoft Station Q Director Chetan Nayak, a professor of physics at UC Santa Barbara and a Technical Fellow for Quantum Hardware at Microsoft. At eight qubits, the researchers’ topological processor is a mere embryo in the world of quantum computers, but marks a major milestone in the scientists’ decades-long quest to develop a topological quantum computer. Along the way, Nayak said, there have been fruitful partnerships between Station Q and the university, especially in the realm of creating the materials that host topological quantum behaviors.

results.title: Quantum Chips: The Brains Behind Quantum Computing - BlueQubit
results.content: With major tech companies and startups actively working to improve performance, reduce error rates, and expand qubit counts, the development of quantum computer chips is a key focus in the global tech industry. ## What Are Quantum Chips? Quantum chips use superposition to allow qubits to exist in multiple states (0 and 1) at the same time, making it possible to carry out parallel computation. As a result, quantum chips can perform complex calculations that scale exponentially with more qubits. Quantum chips work by manipulating quantum bits, or qubits, which can exist in a superposition of states—unlike classical bits that are either 0 or 1. Quantum chips control and measure qubit states using precise microwave pulses, lasers, or magnetic fields. ### Who makes quantum computing chips? Several leading companies and research institutions are developing quantum computing chips. Yes, Google has developed a real quantum chip named Sycamore, which uses 53 superconducting qubits. Quantum chips use qubits, which can exist in superposition and entanglement, allowing them to process multiple possibilities at once.
